title: Be careful about relying on ICD-10 cheat sheets
description: For most physicians, cheat sheets are a pretty good survival tool in the ICD-10 transition. Most will only need to use a small subset of ICD-10 diagnoses – depending on the specialty. But Susan Cooley warns don't depend too heavily on ICD-10 cheat sheets. Her concern is that they may

title: Care coordination leads as biggest challenge for hospitals pursuing population health management
description: More than two-thirds of hospitals and health systems already have population health management programs in place to address readmissions, acute care and patient education, and more than half have programs to support patients with chronic health conditions, according to a healthcare leadership survey by HIMSS Media on behalf of Royal Philips. However, care coordination – a fundamental element of effective population health management – persists as a top challenge for healthcare organizations.
body: More than two-thirds of hospitals and health systems already have population health management programs in place to address readmissions, acute care and patient education, and more than half have programs to support patients with chronic health conditions, according to a healthcare leadership survey by HIMSS Media on behalf of Royal Philips. However, care coordination – a fundamental element of effective population health management – persists as a top challenge for healthcare organizations.

title: Healthcare industry giants pledge to ease interoperability, EHR use
description: The 17 IT companies that made the pledge include Allscripts, athenahealth, Cerner Corp., Epic Systems and Meditech. They provide records systems to 90% of the hospitals in the country. Providers include Ascension, Geisinger, HCA, Intermountain and Kaiser Permanente.

title: CMS releases final 2015 post-ICD-10 metrics: 5 findings
description: Although ICD-10 was once considered the Y2K of the healthcare industry, the coding update came and went with relatively little noise, and relatively unchanged rates of claims denials, according to CMS.
body: Although ICD-10 was once considered the Y2K of the healthcare industry, the coding update came and went with relatively little noise, and relatively unchanged rates of claims denials, according to CMS.

title: CMS posts new rule on Medicare data sharing, analysis
description: Some medical data miners may soon be allowed to share and sell Medicare and private-sector medical-claims data, as well as analyses of that data, under proposed regulations issued by CMS.
body: Some medical data miners may soon be allowed to share and sell Medicare and private-sector medical-claims data, as well as analyses of that data, under proposed regulations issued by CMS.

title: Hospitals get new hope on RAC appeals backlog thanks to Court ruling
description: Hospitals persuaded a federal appeals court to give new life to their legal fight to force HHS to work more quickly through a backlog of disputed findings by Medicare's controversial recovery audit contractors.
body: Hospitals persuaded a federal appeals court to give new life to their legal fight to force HHS to work more quickly through a backlog of disputed findings by Medicare's controversial recovery audit contractors.

title: How mergers may affect care, competition and bottom lines
description: More providers and payors are considering mergers and acquisitions, consolidating operations to boost revenue and save costs. But could the trend actually lead to more trouble for hospitals and patients? Earlier this summer, Anthem, one of the nation's largest insurance companies, announced it would acquire competitor Cigna, renewing concerns among providers about how mergers may impact industry competition and networks.
body: More providers and payors are considering mergers and acquisitions, consolidating operations to boost revenue and save costs. But could the trend actually lead to more trouble for hospitals and patients? Earlier this summer, Anthem, one of the nation's largest insurance companies, announced it would acquire competitor Cigna, renewing concerns among providers about how mergers may impact industry competition and networks.

title: A Nuanced Take On Healthcare Consumerism
description: Read the perspective of four experts on healthcare consumerism, discussing it's impact on innovation and whether -- or not -- government has an important role in protecting public safety.
body: Read the perspective of four experts on healthcare consumerism, discussing it's impact on innovation and whether -- or not -- government has an important role in protecting public safety.

title: Technology is helping consumers make smarter health care decisions
description: New Internet tools give consumers the ability to make smarter health care decisions. The Affordable Care Act has made health insurance more affordable for millions of Americans, addressed the difficult problem of pre-existing conditions and mandated minimum benefit plans, all laudable goals.
body: New Internet tools give consumers the ability to make smarter health care decisions. The Affordable Care Act has made health insurance more affordable for millions of Americans, addressed the difficult problem of pre-existing conditions and mandated minimum benefit plans, all laudable goals.

title: Ready or not, hospitals face mandatory bundling for joint replacement
description: The hips and knees of the nation's seniors were an obvious target for Medicare's first mandatory test of an alternative payment model for hospitals. But joint replacement isn't the only possible target. Hospitals are now on notice that Medicare will move ahead if they don't do it on their own.
body: The hips and knees of the nation's seniors were an obvious target for Medicare's first mandatory test of an alternative payment model for hospitals. But joint replacement isn't the only possible target. Hospitals are now on notice that Medicare will move ahead if they don't do it on their own.

title: ICD-10 two months In: For providers, a transition that came and went
description: To follow is the second of a two part series on the ICD transition by Healthcare Informatics. Says Paul Dufresne, patient account manager at Boston-based Partners HealthCare, the biggest concern leading into the transition was that everyone was mapping what they were doing in the ICD-9 world to try to get equivalent comparisons in ICD-10. "That was the approach that people chose. But that can be subjective, and it could lead to missed diagnoses," Dufresne says. However, he adds, these mapping issues were not nearly as bad as Partners anticipated. "We were expecting big-time disasters, and it wasn't like that at all."
body: To follow is the second of a two part series on the ICD transition by Healthcare Informatics. Says Paul Dufresne, patient account manager at Boston-based Partners HealthCare, the biggest concern leading into the transition was that everyone was mapping what they were doing in the ICD-9 world to try to get equivalent comparisons in ICD-10. "That was the approach that people chose. But that can be subjective, and it could lead to missed diagnoses," Dufresne says. However, he adds, these mapping issues were not nearly as bad as Partners anticipated. "We were expecting big-time disasters, and it wasn't like that at all."

title: Designing Healthcare For Humans
description: Physician reflects on healthcare deliver and why he is "more bullish today on healthcare innovation delivery than I've been at any point in the past decade."

title: Are women treated differently than men in the ER?
description: Read an Atlantic reporter's firsthand account about sexism his wife encountered when seeking emergency treatment.
body: Read an Atlantic reporter's firsthand account about sexism his wife encountered when seeking emergency treatment.

title: First data flows from national registry tracking joint replacements
description: Hospitals can now access national data on hip and knee replacement surgeries thanks to an inaugural report published by the American Joint Replacement Registry. The first national medical procedure registry in the U.S., data will include basic information on roughly 43,000 joint surgeries in 2013. Hip and knee replacement surgeries are among the most common surgical procedures performed in the U.S. and require expensive revisions when they fail.
body: Hospitals can now access national data on hip and knee replacement surgeries thanks to an inaugural report published by the American Joint Replacement Registry. The first national medical procedure registry in the U.S., data will include basic information on roughly 43,000 joint surgeries in 2013. Hip and knee replacement surgeries are among the most common surgical procedures performed in the U.S. and require expensive revisions when they fail.

title: Rural areas face logistical challenges to implement population health
description: Population health is management is a difficulty strategy to pursue in areas where the population is small and spread out.
body: Population health is management is a difficulty strategy to pursue in areas where the population is small and spread out.

title: How the digital hospital is streamlining care workflows
description: This article gives hospital executives a glimpse at how digitization and automation of processes are key to streamlining workflows, enabling providers to spend less time on non-care related tasks and more time on patients.
body: This article gives hospital executives a glimpse at how digitization and automation of processes are key to streamlining workflows, enabling providers to spend less time on non-care related tasks and more time on patients.

title: New ICD-10 code for Zika virus
description: The American Health Information Management Association now has an ICD-10 code for the birth defect-causing Zika virus: A92.8. On Feb. 5, as 11 states had reported travel-associated cases of the Zika virus, AHIMA sent an email to its members recommending they assign that code (for "other specified mosquito-borne viral fevers") to Zika cases.
body: The American Health Information Management Association now has an ICD-10 code for the birth defect-causing Zika virus: A92.8. On Feb. 5, as 11 states had reported travel-associated cases of the Zika virus, AHIMA sent an email to its members recommending they assign that code (for "other specified mosquito-borne viral fevers") to Zika cases.

title: Survey finds productivity down among hospital coders due to ICD-10
description: According to a recent survey, the ICD-10 transition is negatively impacting inpatient and outpatient coder productivity at hospitals of all sizes and types.

title: HHS releases 2016 Marketplace Affordability Snapshot
description: According to an HHS analysis, about eight out of 10 returning consumers will be able to buy a plan with premiums less than $100 dollars a month after tax credits. Across all markets in the 37 states, the cost of the benchmark plan will increase an average of 7.5 percent.
body: According to an HHS analysis, about eight out of 10 returning consumers will be able to buy a plan with premiums less than $100 dollars a month after tax credits. Across all markets in the 37 states, the cost of the benchmark plan will increase an average of 7.5 percent.

title: Looking afield: debt collection tips hospitals can borrow from banks
description: When Southwest Airlines was a fledgling company, it struggled with finding a way to outpace other airlines in a competitive environment. Legendary CEO Herb Kelleher believed Southwest could gain a competitive advantage by focusing on a critical key performance indicator: the time it takes to "turn a plane" (i.e., unload, clean, restock, refuel, reload new passengers, and taxi for take-off).
body: When Southwest Airlines was a fledgling company, it struggled with finding a way to outpace other airlines in a competitive environment. Legendary CEO Herb Kelleher believed Southwest could gain a competitive advantage by focusing on a critical key performance indicator: the time it takes to "turn a plane" (i.e., unload, clean, restock, refuel, reload new passengers, and taxi for take-off).

title: How to handle ICD-10 issues
description: Healthcare organizations can begin directing physicians who are struggling with the ICD-10 transition to a dedicated communications center in Baltimore.

title: In palliative care, comfort is the top priority
description: Palliative care became an approved medical specialty in 2007. Although the general public knows little about it, it has grown rapidly in hospitals. More than 70 percent now offer palliative care services, including 90 percent of those with more than 300 beds.
body: Palliative care became an approved medical specialty in 2007. Although the general public knows little about it, it has grown rapidly in hospitals. More than 70 percent now offer palliative care services, including 90 percent of those with more than 300 beds.

title: Why do doctors choose a $2,000 cure when a $50 one is just as good?
description: Andrew Lam, M.D., is a retinal surgeon, Assistant Professor at Tufts University School of Medicine, and author of "Saving Sight." In this article he discusses why physicians often choose more costly drugs even if other, less costly drugs, are proven to be as effective.
body: Andrew Lam, M.D., is a retinal surgeon, Assistant Professor at Tufts University School of Medicine, and author of "Saving Sight." In this article he discusses why physicians often choose more costly drugs even if other, less costly drugs, are proven to be as effective.
